name: Emirates Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Good but needs more work
reviews.text: Spent four nights in Wolgan Valley Resort, the accommodation was fantastic and the villas compared to other 5 star resorts around the world were very well appointed. The location was very impressive, the resort is surrounded by stunning valleys. Horse riding, mountain bikes and wild life tours were great and the degustation menus were nice, as was the wine. Going to choose cheeses from the cheese room after dinner was a nice touch. The day spa was also lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As some of the other guests have commented the resort has some negatives, the reason for this reviews four star rating.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Firstly the service in the food and beverage department was lacking polish and structure, too many people involved in servicing the same table creating too many inconsistencies. Through out our stay the service was hit and miss every night.
reviews.title: A Dream Resort, almost Perfect
Almost perfect.
reviews.text: My biggest gripe was the taste of the bread - only one variety offered the whole time. The entire duration of our stay the bread tasted stale and bland, and as a person who loves bread so much this was one of the first times in my life that I actually had no interest in eating it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: On our last night I asked for a coffee after our meal and when the waiter arrived with the coffee he proceeded to tell me he had no experience in making coffee so he could make another one if needed. This comment did not create great confidence and after tasting it the coffee was so hot it burnt my tongue which remained painful for the next two days.
reviews.title: Intensive relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The exceptional service exceeded our expectations and the Resort's willingness to assist with my marriage proposal was nothing short of outstanding.
reviews.title: The best of Australia without the worst of it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation was intimate, yet relaxed. The food and wine was world class. The ambience was serene and the good will of the waiting staff was polite and good humoured.
reviews.title: True Indulgence! Nothing I've ever experienced before!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an ecologist, my (new) fiancé was particularly interested in the Resort's on-going rehabilitation of native flora and fauna as well as the control of pests/weeds, which over a 4,000 hectare property is a mammoth task to undertake.
reviews.title: finally there is a world-class resort in new south wales!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A special thanks to those of your staff with whom we interfaced, namely Megan, Sandy, Nadine and the two Bens.
reviews.title: Like Jurrasic Park of Australia...a 6 star experience all the way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My fiance and I have had no hesitation since returning to Sydney to recommend the Wolgan Valley as the place to stay.
reviews.title: Return visit and even better than first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying here for a couple on nights as part of our honeymoon tour of Australia....and it was by far our favourite experience of the whole trip (which included the Park Hyatt in Sydney, Peppers Bale in Port Douglas, Qualia on Hamilton Island and Palazzo Versace on the Gold Coast.
reviews.title: Just perfect.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wolgan Valley is that rare combination of stunning, peaceful setting, understated luxury and discreet and caring service. All staff were at pains to make sure we had everything we needed and nothig was too much trouble. The homestead and suites are lovely and the attention to detail impressive. On top of that the food was delicious, facilities great and we could easily have spent our entire honeymoon there.
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Wolgan Valley for an unforgettable stay....as far as we are concerened you are in a class of your own.........
reviews.title: Very, very special. We love this place!
Stunning!
reviews.text: Who would believe that this resort is tucked away in the Blue Mountains. The resort is set in from the road and the staff collect you from the main gate with a 4WD and this is where the adventure begins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: As you drive toward the main building you know that no expense has been spared. The main building has the most gorgeous furnishings with a definite bush feel. Our room was so beautiful, and the lap pool was well used during our stay. The main pool area is gorgeous and well maintained.
reviews.title: Loved it loved it loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has an almost perfect setting. anybody looking for a location for a honeymoon, anniversary or even proposal....this is it!! sublime!!!
reviews.title: Most amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the resort facilities are great, the villas (suites) are simply amazing!!
reviews.title: Luxury living in a gorgeous secluded valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the main pool is v.good and the feel of the resort is very classy.
reviews.title: Magnificent isolated landscape with amazing luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my only problem was the quality of the food. i felt it didn't rise up to the price tag that is being asked.it simply just didn't quite hit the mark. lots of style, but not quite enough substance for my liking. service was fine though.
reviews.title: Beds are like sleeping on a cloud... gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i wanted to give 4 and a half but have had to settle for 4 instead of 5.
reviews.title: A great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saved the best of our month trip to Australia and New Zealand for the last. In January 2013, we spent three nights in one of the Wolgan Valley villas and thoroughly enjoyed the sights and services of the resort.
reviews.title: A Unique and Special Stay at Wolgan Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the drive up to the resort, we stopped at the Blackfellows Cave to see the native rock drawings. Note that the dirt road to the cave is on the right, after the colliery. You park at the FIRST fork on this unimproved side road and the cave is a SHORT walk from this parking area.
reviews.title: Simply The best accommodation in Australia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After parking and being driven into the resort, we were met at reception with cold towels and a glass of champagne. This was the first indication that this trip would be special.
reviews.title: beautiful area in the wilderness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our stay we enjoyed a guided tour of the property, a night wildlife tour and mountain biking. Due to rain, we had to cancel our horseback ride. The resort staff were also helpful in arranging day hike supplies and a drop-off and pick-up for a 5-6 mile hike to the nearby Glow Worm Tunnel.
reviews.title: Be as active as you like or kick back, relax and enjoy your break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meals and dining services were very good. One night we participated in the nine-course degustation dinner menu. Dinner of the other nights included a barbeque and a la carte menu items. Breakfasts and lunches were fine as well. We particularly enjoyed the experienced dining room services of Alexander, Shane and Martin.
reviews.title: Stunning all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into the Wolgan Valley Resort and Spa as part of review on what it would be like to travel under 3 hours from Sydney, with out the kids for 48 hours. Answer: Blissful experience
reviews.title: 48 Hours with out the kids, bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive at the "gate house", this resort is amazing. The awesome backdrop is a canvas you gaze at all day. What I really liked about the resort is its all inclusive approach, it felt like great value for a resort of this calibre.
reviews.title: LOVED EVERY MINUTE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was incredible, nothing seemed to be a problem at all. The staff are happy and cheerful which makes for happy guests! There are so many little thoughtful things which take you by surprise that the resort provides to ensure your stay is relaxing and memorable.
reviews.title: Everything said about this place is true, it's heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Two ways to experience Wolgan Valley Resort and Spa
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Do nothing and relax in your suite or by the pool, nothing wrong with this approach!
reviews.title: Wish we stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and another couple spent 2 nights here to celebrate a special birthday. The resort is really fantastic - location, views, villas are all outstanding and certainly deserve the 5* rating. We experienced a number of hiccups which were certainly not adequately addressed either at the time or after we wrote to the resort management after returning to Sydney.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort and location but many hiccups

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These issues were (in no particular order):-
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: - on arriving for dinner the first evening we were shown to literally the worst table even though we had pre-booked a "table close to the window" and had specifically stated that we were celebrate a special birthday. This was in spite of the restaurant being less than one third full. When we told the hostess that the table was not acceptable she became very unfriendly, almost aggressive. She reluctantly gave us another much more suitable table.
reviews.title: simply - wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - the dinner was extremely disappointing - very meagre portions - we thought they had run out of food (and none of us are particularly big eaters). The quality was also marginal.
reviews.title: Excellence with a capital E

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: - once we were seated the sommelier immediately approached us and tried to up-sell us on very expensive wines never mentioning the wines which are included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Well done Emirates
"The Valley" changed us
reviews.text: What a way to spend the festive season! Words cannot describe how amazing this place is, nor does the website give this place any justice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon arrive we were greeted and escorted to the Main Homestead where a delicious glass of local sparkling wine was waiting for us. The wonderfully helpful and cheery Bree assisted us at check in and gave us a tour of the place we would be calling “home” for the next few days. And it did feel as if we were at home. That’s how comfortable we felt. The suites, the restaurants and the staff all made us feel comfortable.
reviews.title: Loads of potential but .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is INCREDIBLE! And served by staff that are truly passionate about what they’re doing. Claire, the restaurant manager was always around to make sure our dining experience is special and being looked after by Mitch was a pleasure with his attentiveness and personality.
reviews.title: the best Christmas ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: We also had the pleasure of meeting the executive chef Dwayne Goodman and the GM Joost, whose passion are reflected in their staff.
reviews.title: It was absolutely amazing even with weather not to good for couple of days!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The field activities (included in our package) were fun and informative and the spa is extremely relaxing.
reviews.title: Breathtaking

description: Emirates’ Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa offers the rare opportunity to experience true luxury in a spectacular Australian bush setting.The property borders the Greater Blue Mountains World Heritage wilderness region, just 190kms from Sydney. Nestled between two National Parks and spread out at the foot of towering cliffs, Emirates’ Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa is set within its own private conservation and wildlife reserve. The resort itself occupies just two percent of the total land area of 4,000 acres and its design, reminiscent of traditional rural Australian homesteads, reflects a timeless appeal and a natural sense of place in the vast and dramatic landscape of the Wolgan Valley. The 40 individual suites each have their own private deck and indoor / outdoor swimming pool. The main homestead offers distinctive dining, luxury facilities and the stand-alone Timeless Spa features six double treatment rooms, and a range of signature treatments.The seclusion of Wolgan Valley creates a natural sanctuary where guests can relax and explore in unsurpassed luxurious comfort. This is the quintessential luxury Australian bush experience - a unique blend of wildlife, dramatic natural beauty, conservation, heritage in a spectacular Australian bush setting, which can be explored through a range of activities including four wheel drives, heritage tours, wildlife spotting and horse riding.All meals are included in the tariff with a strong focus on regional and seasonal produce, and where possible organic ingredients are used. Emirates’ Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa is a member of Luxury Lodges of Australia.
